paper_title.en: Strength properties and variance of cement-treated ground using the pneumatic flow mixing method

description.en: In this study, field and laboratory tests were conducted to investigate the strength properties and variance of cement-treated ground, constructed with dredged soils mixed with a small amount of cement by the pneumatic flow mixing method, which has been recently developed in Japan. In the paper an outline of the pneumatic flow mixing system is first presented first. Then various factors causing strength variance of the cement-treated ground are described. It is found that the cement/water ratio of the cement-treated soils, which was monitored and controlled during their production, was stable. The effect of mixing adequacy of the soil/cement mixture and that of non-homogeneity of the dredged soils on the strength variance is discussed. Finally an effective measure to reduce the strength variance is described. © 2007 Thomas Telford Ltd.

paper_title.en: Statistic study on application of geosynthetics for seepage and erosion prevention

description.en: Many sea reclamation projects have been preceded in Japan in order to expand the port and harbour facilities and other infrastructure. These reclaimed lands are surrounded by seawalls, which usually consists of a series of concrete caissons that rested on rubble mound embankment, a cover of concrete blocks in the sea side, a cover of backfill stones with gentle slope in the land side, and a permeable geosynthetics sheet as filter placed on the slope of the backfill stones to hold the reclaimed soil. The damages in geosynthetics sheet introduce the seepage of fine particles from the reclaimed soil to the sea through the backfill stones and rubble mound. The appropriate geosynthetics should be selected from consideration of the function of filter, durability during and after construction. However, as there is a limited research effort for the subject, the type of geosynthetics has been empirically selected by each port construction bureaus. In this study, the statistics investigation on application of geosynthetics for seepage and erosion prevention was conducted in which the field case histories were accumulated and analysed.

paper_title.en: Quality control in Central Japan International Airport construction

description.en: Recently, a pneumatic flow mixing method has been developed for sea reclamation and land development, in which soft soil is mixed with a relatively small amount of stabilising agent in a transporting pipe. The soil mixture forms several separated mud plugs in the pipe, and is thoroughly mixed with the help of turbulent flow during transportation. This method was adopted to construct part of a man-made island for the Central Japan International Airport at the Ise Bay area in Nagoya. In the construction project, a total of 8·6 million m3 of dredged soil was stabilised by the method for sea reclamation. During the construction, quality control and assurance of manufacturing the treated soil were carried out with an automated control system and laboratory tests on sampled soils. In this paper, the quality control system developed in this project and the quality assurance of the improved ground are described in detail. © 2005 Thomas Telford Ltd.
